definition-item.definition-title: TICKET-ISSUING APPARATUS; FARE-REGISTERING APPARATUS; FRANKING APPARATUS

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Machines for printing and issuing tickets
Details of, or auxiliary devices for, ticket-issuing machines
Holders providing direct manual access to tickets
Apparatus for validating or cancelling issued tickets
Arrangements or apparatus for collecting fares, tolls or entrance fees at one or more control points

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Handling of coins or of paper currency or similar valuable papers
Mechanisms actuated by objects other than coins to free or to actuate vending, hiring; Coin or paper currency dispensing or refunding apparatus
Coin-freed apparatus for hiring articles; Coin-freed facilities or services

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Output mechanism for digital computers in which all the computation is effected mechanically

section-body.paragraph-text: Use of Indexing Codes:
All ECLA classes have a corresponding G07B Indexing Code-code, which is to be used for secondary aspects (non-invention aspects).

In groups G07B1/00 - G07B15/00, from 01/03/2003 onwards, new documents are classified according to the ECLA Reform approach, i.e. "invention information" is identified with classification symbols, e.g. G07B1/00, while "additional information" is identified with Indexing Code symbols, e.g. G07B1/00.

definition-item.definition-title: Machines for printing and issuing tickets (printing mechanisms per se B41; output mechanisms of digital computers G06C11/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Ticket printers dedicated to tickets.
This place does not cover:
This group contains all mechanical aspect of the machine. For computer implemented ticket printing and issuing system, see G07B15/00.

definition-item.definition-title: employing selectable printing plates

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Ticket printers comprising pre-defined printing plates (heads), e.g. "valid", "void".

definition-item.definition-title: wherein the plates are inserted

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Ticket printers comprising pre-defined removable printing plates (head).

definition-item.definition-title: without selectable printing plates

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Ticket printers comprising individual printing heads, e.g. numbers or letters turning on rollers.

definition-item.definition-title: portable

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The ticket printers are portable.

definition-item.definition-title: Machines for issuing preprinted tickets

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
the printing of tickets which are already pre-printed, meaning the ticket "data carrier" is already pre-printed with some information before storage in the ticket printer.

definition-item.definition-title: from stock in wound strip form

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Tickets paper supply in wound strip form.

definition-item.definition-title: from a stack

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Ticket paper supply from a stack.

definition-item.definition-title: Details of, or auxiliary devices for, ticket-issuing machines (for validating inserted tickets G07B11/02)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The details of the machines for printing and issuing tickets.
This place does not cover:

definition-item.definition-title: for cutting-off or separating tickets

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Means for separating tickets in the machine (e.g.. cutter).

definition-item.definition-title: for recording or registering tickets issued

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Means for recording or registering the issued tickets (e.g. storage means).

definition-item.definition-title: for preventing fraudulent operation

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Means for preventing unwanted operation (e.g.. preventing from being pulled out or printing an authorization mark).

definition-item.definition-title: for avoiding incorrect action of the machine

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Means for monitoring and avoiding incorrect action (e.g.. anti-jam, or testing printed ticket).

definition-item.definition-title: indicating when ticket supply is exhausted

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Means for indicating exhausted ticket supply (e.g. marking paper or paper sensor).

definition-item.definition-title: allowing manual writing on the tickets

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Specific tickets permitting additional manual writing on the tickets.

definition-item.definition-title: Holders providing direct manual access to the tickets

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Holders for tickets with dispensing means for manual access to the tickets.

definition-item.definition-title: Ticket punches (perforating pliers B26F1/36; marking record carriers in digital fashion by punching G06K1/02)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Devices for punching tickets in order to only make a hole (basic validation).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Apparatus for validating issued tickets by perforation
Marking record carriers in digital fashion by punching

definition-item.definition-title: Toy ticket-punches

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Portable ticket punch apparatuses (e.g.. for punching tickets before entering an attraction or selection on lottery ticket).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Marking record carriers in digital fashion by punching

definition-item.definition-title: Apparatus for validating or cancelling issued tickets

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Apparatus for the validation or cancellation of issued ticket; for example in public transports or gaming tickets.

definition-item.definition-title: for validating inserted tickets

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

The devices for "validating" or "cancelling" already issued tickets, for example by printing a "marking" on the ticket or by "cutting off" a part of the ticket. The ticket can be a ticket for accessing an event, public transportation or lottery tickets for example.

definition-item.definition-title: by printing

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Apparatus for validation of the tickets by printing some marking (e.g.. identification or date/time).

definition-item.definition-title: by perforating

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Apparatus for validation of tickets for validation by insertion in a slot and perforation.

definition-item.definition-title: by separating part of ticket

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The device comprises means for separating a part of the ticket in order to validate the ticket.

definition-item.definition-title: combined with receptacle for separated part of ticket (refuse receptacles in general B65F1/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The device comprises means for separating a part of the ticket in order to validate the ticket.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: for cancelling tickets

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The device comprises means for cancelling the tickets (e.g.. by printing, perforating, cutting or other means).

definition-item.definition-title: Taximeters (measuring distance travelled G01C; measuring time G04)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Taximeters in general.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {operating mechanically}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Devices comprising mechanical or electromechanical means for operation of the taximeter.

definition-item.definition-title: Details; Accessories

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The details and/or accessories of the taximeters (e.g. connectors, etc).

definition-item.definition-title: for indicating fare or state of hire

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Means for indicating price to be paid and/or fare (e.g. display means).

definition-item.definition-title: {with indicating means on the outside of the vehicle}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Means for indicating outside vehicle if taxi is occupied and/or fare.

definition-item.definition-title: Driving arrangements

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Means for obtaining distance travelled and used by the meter for calculation.

definition-item.definition-title: Tariff-changing arrangements

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Means for changing tariff, e.g. push-buttons or remotely by downloading new data.

definition-item.definition-title: automatically actuated

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Means for automatically changing tariff, e.g. based on calendar, time or location with GPS.

definition-item.definition-title: Arrangements or apparatus for collecting fares, tolls or entrance fees at one or more control points (handling coins or valuable papers, e.g. banknotes, G07D; apparatus for vending or hiring articles or services activated by coins, credit cards, paper currency or the like G07F7/00, G07F17/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: Access with payment with or without ticket
Systems for reserving, ordering, loading and using access tickets
Systems for reserving and using access tickets, e.g. check-in systems

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Handling of coins or valuable papers
Mechanisms for vending or hiring articles or services
Coin-freed apparatus for hiring articles other than vehicles

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
Tickets for public transportation without reference to time or distance travelled have to be classified in main group (G07B15/00).
Tickets for public transportation based on time or distance travelled have to be classified in G07B15/02,e.g.. the way the ticket is used.
Data processing aspects of payment systems or protocols relating to toll, entrance fee or fare collection, e.g. in road pricing or congestion charging, are also classified in G06Q20/00.

definition-item.definition-title: taking into account a variable factor such as distance or time, e.g. for passenger transport, parking systems or car rental systems (G07B15/06 takes precedence; taximeters G07B13/00; parking meters per se G07F17/24; {car rental systems per se G07B15/00})

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

list-item.paragraph-text: public transportation payment based on the travelled journey; and
parking payment based on the parking time (parking reservation and parking management systems, parking ticket enforcement systems, parking meters for a plurality of parking spaces...).

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Arrangements for road pricing or congestion charging of vehicles or vehicle users, e.g. automatic toll systems
Parking meters without payment means installed inside vehicles
Parking meters, per se (for one parking meter)

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Vending services in function of time
Machines for vending or hiring services paid by card

section-body.paragraph-text: Toll Payment system have to be classified in G07B15/06 .
Taximeter have to be classified in G07B13/00.
Parking meters installed inside vehicle have to be classified in G07C1/30.
Car rental systems, per se, have to be classified in G07B15/00.

definition-item.definition-title: comprising devices to free a barrier, turnstile, or the like {(turnstiles with registering means G07C9/10; coin-freed aspects G07F17/00)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The person or vehicle has to free a fence (e.g.. turnstile, barrier, door).
This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Mechanisms for vending or hiring articles or services

section-body.paragraph-text: Toll Payment system with barrier have to be classified in G07B15/04 .

definition-item.definition-title: Arrangements for road pricing or congestion charging of vehicles or vehicle users, e.g. automatic toll systems

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

the identification or tracking of vehicles or vehicle users for the purpose of road pricing or congestion charging, which means that vehicles or vehicle users are not necessarily channelled through fixed control points, e.g. toll booths or overhead gantries, but may be detected at a number of places when they travel in normal fashion in a pre-defined locality, e.g. a defined area in a city centre or an expressway, and where the information so generated is then used to determine a charge to be paid.
This group covers means for paying and using toll roads including:

list-item.paragraph-text: cameras for recognizing number plate or ID.

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Traffic control systems for road vehicles

definition-item.definition-title: {using wireless information transmission between the vehicle and a fixed station (identification of vehicles G08G)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Every wireless communication between the vehicle and a fixed station for use of toll road, which can be with a central station or local beacons (e.g.. wireless communication with toll booth).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {being coin-operated}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Means for the payment of toll roads using coins, e.g. toll booths with coins collector.
This place does not cover:
Payment means using cards (credit cards) have to classified in G07B15/06.

definition-item.definition-title: Franking apparatus (printing aspects B41)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Apparatus for franking mail items.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Type printers, selective printing mechanisms e.g. ink-jet printers, thermal printers

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Printing aspects: Type printers, selective printing mechanisms e.g. ink-jet printers, thermal printers
Systems and methods specially adapted for administrative, commercial, financial, managerial or supervisory purposes

section-body.paragraph-text: Use of Indexing Codes:
Sub-aspects of subclasses are classified with G07B17/00 Indexing Codes.
Additional aspects are classified by corresponding Indexing Codes.
Each document is classified in principle with one subclass corresponding to the main aspect and optionally several Indexing Codes.

definition-item.definition-title: {operated by portable carriers, e.g. for inputting credit or information}

section-body.paragraph-text: Not to be used anymore.
Replaced by Indexing Code G07B2017/00177.

definition-item.definition-title: {Relations between apparatus, e.g. franking machine at customer or apparatus at post office, in a franking system}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Relations between apparatuses in a franking system.

definition-item.definition-title: {Physical or organizational aspects of franking systems}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Physical or organisation aspects of franking systems (determining the location of an apparatus, determining the location of mail pieces outside apparatus, i.e. tracking of mail pieces, software architecture, e.g. client/server,...).

definition-item.definition-title: {Communication details outside or between apparatus (coin-freed apparatus for franking per se G07F17/26)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Communication details outside or between apparatus (landlines, wireless, LAN, Internet, for sending information from central location, e.g. for updating rates or software, for sending information from a franking apparatus, e.g. for verifying accounting, for sending information from a portable device, e.g. card or PCMCIA,...).
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Coin-freed apparatus for franking per se
Mechanisms actuated by objects other than coins to free or to actuate vending, hiring, coin or paper currency dispensing or refunding apparatus for cashless transactions only

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Details internally of apparatus in a franking system, e.g. franking machine at customer or apparatus at post office (digital data processing G06F; coin-freed apparatus for franking per se G07F17/26)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Details internally of apparatus in a franking system.
The apparatus can be a local device or a distant server.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: System and methods specially adapted for administrative purposes
Business processes related to postal services
Coin-freed apparatus for franking per se

definition-item.definition-title: {Constructional details of apparatus in a franking system}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Constructional details of apparatus in a franking system (open franking system, i.e. the printer is not dedicated to franking only, e.g. personal computer, mailbox, i.e. container for mail, portable franking apparatus, i.e. the whole franking apparatus, not parts alone, vending machine or POS (Point of sale) apparatus, housing, e.g. lock or hardened casing, modular design, storage of e.g. ribbon, electronic hardware aspects, e.g. types of circuits used, man-machine interface on the apparatus, ...).

definition-item.definition-title: {Communication within apparatus, personal computer [PC] system, or server, e.g. between printhead and central unit in a franking machine}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Communication aspects within franking apparatus (communication between components, modules, parts, e.g. printer, keyboard, conveyor or central unit,communication with software components, error detection or handling, power handling,setting of date,...).

definition-item.definition-title: {Calculation or computing within apparatus, e.g. calculation of postage value}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Calculation or computing within apparatus (calculation of postage value, calculation of different sending options, currency calculation, memory organisation, redundant storage, software organisation, special accounting procedures,...).
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Cryptography or similar procedures in a franking system

definition-item.definition-title: {Details specific to central, non-customer apparatus, e.g. servers at post office or vendor}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Details specific to central, non-customer apparatus, e.g. servers at post office or vendor (for verification of mail pieces by checking databases,...).

definition-item.definition-title: {Details relating to mailpieces in a franking system}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Details relating to mail pieces in a franking system.

definition-item.definition-title: {Transporting mailpieces (postal sorting B07C)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Transporting mail pieces in a franking apparatus (sorting mail pieces, e.g. to get reduced postal rates, batch processing of mail pieces, mail/envelope/insert handling system, e.g. mechanical details or weight optimisation, measures for preventing or handling mailpieces stoppages, e.g. paper jam,...).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices for inserting documents into envelopes

definition-item.definition-title: {Printing or attaching on mailpieces (printing mechanisms B41J; security printing B41M3/14; marking methods B41M5/00; inks C09D11/00; record carriers with at least a part designed to carry digital markings G06K19/00)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Printing or attaching on mailpieces in a franking apparatus (details of printing apparatus, e.g. printheads, ensuring quality of print,details of printed item, e.g. code, address, advert or logo, attaching item on mail piece, e.g. label or circuit, special printing techniques, e.g. interlacing, separating fixed and variable parts, special inks, e.g. fluorescent,...).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Record carriers with at least a part designed to carry digital markings

definition-item.definition-title: {Sensing or measuring mailpieces (weighing G01G19/00)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Sensing or measuring mail pieces in a franking apparatus (sensing position of mail piece, measuring the dimensions of mail piece, measuring the speed of mail pieces inside apparatus, measuring the weight of mail pieces, scanning or imaging mail pieces, reading barcodes or symbols,...).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Recognition or understanding of postal images

definition-item.definition-title: {Cryptography or similar special procedures in a franking system}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Cryptography or similar special procedures in a franking system (specific cryptography algorithms, time dependency, e.g. timestamps, validity time, continuous communication, including postal data or personal data, i.e. biometrics, key management, passwords, compression techniques, error handling, e.g. EDC (Error Detection Codes), cryptographic mocules, e.g. PSD (Postal Security Device),...).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Security arrangements for protecting computers or computer systems against unauthorised activity
Record carriers with conductive marks and special arrangements for circuits, e.g. for protecting identification code in memory
Recognition or understanding of postal images

Access-control involving the use of a pass in combination with an identity-check of the pass-holder by means of personal physical data, e.g. characteristic facial curves, hand geometry, voice spectrum, fingerprints
Mechanisms actuated by objects other than coins to free or to actuate vending, hiring, coin or paper currency dispensing or refunding apparatus for cashless transactions only
Circuits generating pulses having a predetermined statistical distribution
Coding, decoding or code conversion, for error detection or error correction
Arrangements for secret or secure communication

section-body.paragraph-text: Not necessarily standard mathematical cryptography.
